election_record.label: New York 1822 Constitutional Convention

overview.note: The vote approving the new State Constitution passed, which resulted in some major changes to the political process. Elections were moved from April to November, the two tiered system of voting was abolished, as was the Council of Appointments. State Senate Districts were changed and various county officials were now chosen by popular votes.

It appears that most of the newspapers giving the State Wide Returns by counties were reprinting the results as published in the Albany Daily Advertiser (Albany, NY), and perhaps another Albany newspaper, probably The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY), a few say they were quoting their returns from an Albany letter, dated February 14th. Most of these returns were those being received by the Secretary of State's Office and filed there until Officially counted by Canvass Board, which comprised the Secretary of State, Surveyor General, Attorney General, Comptroller and Treasure. The heading on the results from the New York Statesman, which is quoting the Albany Daily Advertiser (Albany, NY), does suggest that the returns listed, although from the Secretary Of State's Office, were not yet final, as they state the following: 'The official canvass, we understand, is to be made today.' Unfortunately there were some issues with the votes filed in the Secretary of State's Office, which the newspapers printed and the eventual votes reported in the Official Canvass. Even more unfortunate is that in some counties, both sets of returns got injected into the final vote. This may help explain why in some cases the town totals reported in The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) do not match the County votes listed in the State Wide Recapitulation, which were both given in the same issue. Some of the differences are explained in The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) under the "Towns Rejected" section of the Official Canvass. Others errors hopefully are just type setting mistakes.

sub_unit.name: Chazy
sub_unit.note: The Plattsburgh Republican (Plattsburgh, NY) lists 209 yes and 19 no votes.

sub_unit.name: Mooers
sub_unit.note: The Plattsburgh Republican (Plattsburgh, NY) lists 32 yes votes.

sub_unit.name: Delaware
sub_unit.note: The following newspapers list the total No vote in Delaware County as 637: American Journal (Ithaca, NY) of February 27, 1822, Plattsburgh Republican (Plattsburgh, NY) of February 23, 1822, The Statesman and Advertiser (For the County) of New York February 21, 1822, The Watch-Tower of February 25, 1822 and The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) of February 19, 1822.

sub_unit.name: Essex
sub_unit.note: The following newspapers list the total No vote in Essex County as 165: Republican Chronicle (Ithaca, NY) of February 27, 1822, Northern Budget (Troy, NY) of February 26, 1822 and The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) of February 19, 1822.

sub_unit.name: Genesee
sub_unit.note: The following newspapers list the total No vote in Genesee County as 1056: The Statesman and Advertiser of February 21, 1822, The Watch-Tower of February 25, 1822 and Plattsburgh Republican (Plattsburgh, NY) of February 23, 1822.
The American Journal (Ithaca, NY) list the total No vote in Essex County as 1056 amd the total Yes vote as 2789.
The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) lists the total No vote in Essex County as 1056 amd the total Yes vote as 2686.

sub_unit.name: Salisbury
sub_unit.note: "Salisbury, in Herkimer county, returned in figures, and not in words at length." The Albany Argus (Albany, NY). February 19, 1822. The town totals for Salisbury were not included in the Herkimer County totals, which were Yes 1544, No 1158.

sub_unit.name: Madison
sub_unit.note: The following newspapers, gives the total No vote in Madison County as 783: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) of February 19, 1822, Northern Budget (Troy, NY) of February 26, 1822 and Republican Chronicle (Ithaca, NY) of February 27, 1822 .

sub_unit.name: Cazenovia
sub_unit.note: There was one NAY vote in Cazenovia which has been credited to the NO vote count.

sub_unit.name: Niagara
sub_unit.note: "Niagara, in Niagara county not returned by the clerk of Niagara county, but by the clerk of Erie." The Albany Argus (Albany, NY). February 19, 1822. The town totals for Niagara were not included in the Niagara County totals, which were Yes 610, No 104.

sub_unit.name: Onondaga
sub_unit.note: The following newspapers, list the total No vote in Onondaga County as 1514: American Journal (Ithaca, NY) of February 27, 1822, Plattsburgh Republican (Plattsburgh, NY) of February 23, 1822, The Watch-Tower of February 25, 1822, The Statesman and Advertiser of February 21, 1822 and Northern Budget (Troy, NY) of February 26, 1822.

sub_unit.name: Ontario
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) lists two different totals. In the town breakdown section the total given is 2767 Yes votes, while in the Recapitulation section it gives 2752 Yes votes. Additionally, doing the math, with the town figures as given in The Albany Argus (Albany, NY), you get a total of 2810 Yes votes.
The town totals used are taken from The Gazette February 6, 1822. Doing the math with the totals given, you get 2750 Yes votes.

The following newspapers, list the total Yes vote in Ontario County as 2767: The Statesman and Advertiser of February 21, 1822, The Watch-Tower of February 25, 1822 and Plattsburgh Republican (Plattsburgh, NY) of February 23, 1822.
The American Journal (Ithaca, NY) lists the total Yes vote in Ontario County as 2766.

sub_unit.name: Milo
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) lists 62 Yes votes in the town of Milo.

sub_unit.name: Naples
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) lists 87 Yes votes in the town of Naples.

sub_unit.name: Deerpark
sub_unit.note: "Three towns in Orange remain to be heard from. Verbal information states, that Wallkill gave 36 majority against - Minisink 32 and Deerpaark 47 majority, in favor of the constitution." The Statesman and The Daily Advertiser (New York, NY). January 23, 1822.

sub_unit.name: Minisink
sub_unit.note: "Three towns in Orange remain to be heard from. Verbal information states, that Wallkill gave 36 majority against - Minisink 32 and Deerpaark 47 majority, in favor of the constitution." The Statesman and The Daily Advertiser (New York, NY). January 23, 1822.

sub_unit.name: Wallkill
sub_unit.note: "Three towns in Orange remain to be heard from. Verbal information states, that Wallkill gave 36 majority against - Minisink 32 and Deerpaark 47 majority, in favor of the constitution." The Statesman and The Daily Advertiser (New York, NY). January 23, 1822.

sub_unit.name: Oswego
sub_unit.note: "Towns Rejected: Not returned by the Clerk of Oswego, but by the clerks of Oneida and Onondaga. Constantine, Hanibal, Oswego, Volney and Williamstown." The Albany Argus (Albany, NY). February 19, 1822.

sub_unit.name: Otsego
sub_unit.note: The following newspapers list the total Yes vote in Otsego County as 2707: American Journal (Ithaca, NY) of February 27, 1822, Plattsburgh Republican (Plattsburgh, NY) of February 23, 1822, The Watch-Tower of February 25, 1822 and The Statesman and Advertiser of February 21, 1822.

The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) lists two different totals. In the town breakdown section the total given is 2707 Yes votes, while in the Recapitulation section it gives 2684 Yes votes. Additionally, doing the math, with the town figures as given in The Albany Argus (Albany, NY), you get a total of 2810 Yes votes.

sub_unit.name: Saratoga
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) lists two different totals. In the town breakdown section the total given is 2330 Yes votes, while in the Recapitulation section it gives 2334 Yes votes. Additionally, doing the math, with the town figures as given in the Albay Argus, you get a total of 2810 Yes votes.

The following newspapers, gives the total Yes vote in Saratoga County as 2330: American Journal (Ithaca, NY) of February 27, 1822, Plattsburgh Republican (Plattsburgh, NY) of February 23, 1822, The Watch-Tower of February 25, 1822 and The Statesman and Advertiser of February 21, 1822.

sub_unit.name: Broome
sub_unit.note: No returns.

sub_unit.name: Marlborough
sub_unit.note: Spelled as Marbleborough in The Albany Argus (Albany, NY).

sub_unit.name: Wawarsing
sub_unit.note: Spelled as Warwarsing in The Albany Argus (Albany, NY).
